Posts.Content: Aug 24, 2016 02:19PM Sarahalizabeth wrote: biopsy is finished and I am home resting now.. It wasn't too bad but we will see how I feel as the numbing wears off!! They told me I should have results in a week. So now the wait.... Trying to relax today and then stay busy the rest of the time. What are some things you ladies did to help keep you from going crazy waiting for that call
Posts.Title: 25years old- biopsy in the morning. Sarahalizabeth Sarahalizabeth

Posts.Content: Aug 24, 2016 11:41PM Sarahalizabeth wrote: thank you for your reply RockingT! My biopsy was this morning and went smooth- just some soreness here and there. I'm so glad to hear that you were still able to be An active part in your children's lives! Thank you for reaching out.
Posts.Title: 25years old- biopsy in the morning. Sarahalizabeth Sarahalizabeth

Posts.Content: Aug 23, 2016 07:17PM Sarahalizabeth wrote: thank you for you response Elaine! I am actually already on anti- anxiety meds because I have anxiety as it is but I am definitely going to ask about upping my dose. They gave me one Ativan pill to take before the biopsy- hopefully that we'll help me to relax during the procedure. I am trying to not assume cancer- but at the same I would rather prepare for the worst and hope for the best- that way I can be pleasantly surprised instead of in complete shock! Hopefully the waiting game afterwards won't be too bad. I've had 9 surgeries but I have to admit I am nervous about being awake during the biopsy
Posts.Title: 25years old- biopsy in the morning. Sarahalizabeth Sarahalizabeth

Posts.Content: Aug 29, 2016 12:58AM Sarahalizabeth wrote: update: still no results- but now I have a weird red patchy spot on my breast that the lump is on :/ it's not where my insicion is, or even on the needle path. It's starting to sink in that there might really be something wrong, and the wait is horrible. Is this also a symptom? I have been too nervous to google it- as my mind is running enough on its own.
Posts.Title: 25years old- biopsy in the morning. Sarahalizabeth Sarahalizabeth

Posts.Content: Aug 24, 2016 01:07AM Sarahalizabeth wrote: thank you ladies for all of your support. I'll post an update after the biopsy :) I am just relaxing tonight and trying to find my calm and get some good sleep. How long do results typically take?

Posts.Content: Aug 29, 2016 03:00PM Sarahalizabeth wrote: called the dr today- and it's benign! She said the radiologist still needs to review and the team needs to talk about what they suggest from here- but it's not cancer. I am relived- but it's almost taking a bit to sink in! How do you flip the switch to excitement after such an emotional time!! Thank you for all your support- and I hope you ladies and having a wonderful day.ill update more if they suggest anything further
